snippet: Is the best way to teach a child to really cook to have him prepare a weekly family meal?
abstract: Is the best way to teach a child to really cook to have him prepare a weekly family meal?
lead_paragraph: A friend told me last night that she wouldn't consider her 13-year-old  to have "come of age" until he could, among other things, make a mayonnaise. I'm sure Leslie Kaufman would approve. As she describes in the Dining section today, her two sons - aged 10 and 14, each cook dinner once a week - a full dinner, with as little help and oversight as she can muster.
